meanings.definition: To enclose or become enclosed in a cyst.
meanings.sent1: The tiny organism will encyst itself for protection.
meanings.sent2: The doctor observed the cells beginning to encyst.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria decided to encyst and throw a cyst party.
meanings.sent4: The treasure was encysted in a mysterious shell.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar will encyst itself before transforming into a butterfly.

meanings.definition: To form a cyst around something.
meanings.sent1: The body's defense mechanism will encyst the foreign object.
meanings.sent2: The spider will encyst its prey for later consumption.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to encyst the acorn in a bubble.
meanings.sent4: The knight encysted the dragon's heart in a magical shield.
meanings.sent5: The oyster will encyst the irritant to create a pearl.

meanings.definition: To encapsulate or surround in a protective covering.
meanings.sent1: The scientist will encyst the fragile specimen for transport.
meanings.sent2: The tree roots encysted the buried treasure for centuries.
meanings.sent3: The superhero decided to encyst the villain in a bubble.
meanings.sent4: The protective mother encysted her child in layers of blankets.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact was encysted in a glass case for display.
